titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Daughters of the American Revolution, Quakertown Chapter records

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Daughters of the American Revolution, Quakertown Chapter records

archdesc.bioghist: The Quakertown Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution was established in Farmington, Michigan in 1971 with E. Marguerite Henke as Organizing Regent. It was disbanded in 1996.
archdesc.scopecontent: The record group contains the following series: Minutes, 1971-1996, and Applications. Administration records includes: by-laws, correspondence, 1994-1996, disbandment, financial records, history, Registrar reports, 1973-1996, Treasurer reports, 1981-1997, and yearbook, 1995-1996. There are also Awards, Centennial Jubilee Committee reports, 1971-1990, Photographs, and Guest Books. Scrapbooks, cover the years 1971 to 1992.
